document_data.name: Whitestone
document_data.mainbody: '''Whitestone''' was a [[dwarven citadel]] in the [[Tears of Selûne]]. It was home to the [[Whitebeards]], a clan of [[Shield dwarf|mountain dwarves]] who mined the mountains in the [[Neverwinter Wood]] during winter.
document_data.Geography:
The citadel was a mountain-sized city, carved out of an enormous white stone. It was shaped to resemble a helmed long-bearded [[dwarf]] warrior.

The citadel's main entrance was through the figure's "mouth". The entrance led to a lake on which a number of [[spelljammer]]s were kept docked for different purposes.

Whitestone's slow orbit around [[Toril]] and its own motion within the Tears brought it closest to the planet during winter in [[north Faerûn]]. The dwarves took advantage of this proximity to send [[mining ship (spelljammer)|mining ship]]s to [[Mount Hotenow]] and the surrounding areas in the [[Neverwinter Wood]].
document_data.Government: The Whitebeards were led by King [[Gundulph Whitebeard VII]].
document_data.Defenses: Whitestone was guarded by a fleet of huge [[stone ship]]s.
document_data.History: Sometime in the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]], the crew of one of the mining ships was captured and held hostage by a crew of pirates from a marooned [[nautiloid]] that had crash-landed on the [[Neverwinter River]] after a battle with one of the stone warships that guarded Whitestone.
